thread.title: Hunky dad-to-be Jason Statham shows off rippling abs as he prepares to welcome first child with fiancée Rosie Hungtington-Whiteley
thread.title_full: Hunky dad-to-be Jason Statham shows off rippling abs as he prepares to welcome first child with fiancée Rosie Hungtington-Whiteley

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Hunky dad-to-be Jason Statham shows off rippling abs as he prepares to welcome first child with fiancée Rosie Hungtington-Whiteley
text:
Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
Jason Statham might be about to become a dad – and turn 50 – but he’s certainly not going to let himself go any time soon. 
The actor – who’s expecting his first child with his fiancée Rosie Huntington-Whiteley – has showed off his impressive physique for the latest issue of Men’s Health magazine. 
And the dad-to-be revealed that he’s not letting his age slow him down. 
“I’m moving better than I used to. I’m feeling pretty nimble,” he said. Jason Statham shows off his impressive figure (Photo: Mens Health) The 49 year old grabs some kettle bells (Photo: Mens Health) 
“It’s about the whole thing: training, eating, sleeping... all of those have a massive impact on how you feel. 
“And I’m doing better at all of those things. Sly Stallone’s got 20 years on me and still looks good so he’s part of my inspiration.” 
And he revealed that he admires the action-film veteran. Jason is about to become a dad for the first time (Photo: Mens Health) He takes his fitness seriously (Photo: Mens Health) 
“He has a lot of confidence, and great ideas about how things will play out. He doesn’t work from a textbook and he didn’t learn it from film school,” she said. 
“He is Rocky. That’s what he’s like. Everything he does seems to be with a natural swagger. And, like in any kind of business, when you see someone doing their thing so well, you become a sponge. You soak it up.” 
Talking about his fitness, the actor also revealed that he enjoys to practise Brazilian jiu-jitsu with Guy Ritchie. Jason will turn 50 later this year (Photo: Mens Health) He showed off his incredible strength (Photo: Mens Health) He revealed who his fitness heroes are (Photo: Mens Health) 
“I remember when we started out, we’d go on a press tour for Lock, Stock… and we’d be moving all the furniture out of the way in the hotel room, trying to choke each other out,” he said. 
He added: “You turn up with a scrape on your head and the interviewer is like, ‘Where did that come from?’ They probably thought we’d stumbled out of a bar and had a fight with the pavement.” Jason trained with Guy Ritchie (Photo: Mens Health) He admires Sly Stallone (Photo: Mens Health) Jason Statham is on the cover of Men's Health (Photo: Mens Health) 
He also revealed that he admires UFC fighter Conor McGregor. 
"I love him. He’s so good. He’s got every aspect of what he does down to a fine art. He’s got the ability and he’s so confident," Jason said. 
"When it comes to the banter, the destruction of his opponent mentally, there’s no one better. I can’t get enough of him. I think he’s superb." Like us on Facebook
